author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
review: A masterpiece capturing the essence of the Jazz Age, its decadence, and the elusive American Dream.

author: Harper Lee
review: A poignant exploration of racial injustice, moral growth, and the innocence of childhood in the American South.

bookName: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
review: An absurd and hilarious journey through space, filled with wit, satire, and existential musings.

author: George Orwell
review: A chilling dystopian vision of a totalitarian regime, exploring themes of surveillance, oppression, and resistance.

author: J.D. Salinger
review: A poignant portrayal of adolescent angst and alienation, capturing the complexities of growing up.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
review: A delightful and adventurous tale set in Middle-earth, filled with magic, creatures, and epic quests.
